Text saved: Wasfia Nazreen first saw a hula hoop, which is a large plastic ring that you spin around your body, when she was a young girl. She saw a foreign child playing with it in her home country, Bangladesh. Wasfia watched, but she didn't want to, because people in her country believed that girls should not play with hula hoops or ride bikes. Now, Wasfia is one of only a few people in the world who have climbed the seven highest mountains, for example, Everest and Kilimanjaro. She is also the first person to use a hula hoop on each of these mountains. She did this to help women and girls in her country feel stronger, because her country does not encourage them to do sport.
